string.text:
%c[0,56,209,115]Information
%c[0,170,170,170]A strange, heavily contaminated area. Should you wander deeper into it, you will see a shallow lake, crammed short-to-shore with abandoned equipment and other debris. You can also check out the abandoned Institute and the factory, though the military have been hanging around there quite a lot recently. 
 
%c[0,56,166,209]Connected Locations%c[0,170,170,170] 
• Great Swamps 
• Garbage 
• Yantar 
 
%c[0,209,209,56]Trivia%c[0,170,170,170] 
• Many similarities in both layout and terrain can be found in the Army Warehouses. 
• This location featured in S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Clear Sky. 
• This location featured in S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Shadow of Chernobyl.

%c[0,250,250,250]The Agroprom Underground%c[0,170,170,170] is a subterranean network of tunnels.
 
%c[0,56,209,115]Information%c[0,170,170,170] 
Nobody is all too sure what the intended purpose of these catacombs was, as whilst some compartments were clearly used for necessities such as plumbing, others appear distinctly scientific in nature.
 
As of now their only remaining use is for the mass farming of artefacts from its dozens of anomalies, and as a hunting ground for bandits and mutants which prey on unsuspecting stalkers that venture within. 
 
%c[0,209,209,56]Trivia%c[0,170,170,170] 
• As of update 1.4 this location is a merge of both iterations seen during the series. 
• This location featured in S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Clear Sky. 
• This location featured in S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Shadow of Chernobyl.

%c[0,56,209,115]Information
%c[0,170,170,170]A deserted army base next to a dilapidated hamlet and a small marsh. The village is an eerie place literally swarming with mutants - the bloodsuckers alone are legion. Stalkers do their best to keep away from it, even if it means going extra kilometers around it. The anarchists from the Freedom faction have settled down in the army base. The road connecting the base to the Zone is guarded by the Brain Scorcher, which blocks the way to Pripyat and the Chernobyl NPP. 
 
%c[0,56,166,209]Connected Locations%c[0,170,170,170] 
• Rostok 
• Dead City 
• Red Forest 
• Radar 
• Truck Cemetery 
 
%c[0,209,209,56]Trivia%c[0,170,170,170] 
• Many similarities in both layout and terrain can be found in Agroprom. 
• This location featured in S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Clear Sky. 
• This location featured in S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Shadow of Chernobyl.

The %c[0,250,250,250]Chernobyl NPP%c[0,170,170,170], known as the %c[0,56,209,115]V.I. Lenin NPP%c[0,170,170,170] during Soviet times, is considered the most iconic landmark in the Zone.
 
%c[0,56,209,115]Information%c[0,170,170,170] 
It was here on April 26th, 1986 that the first disaster occurred, after reactor 4 exploded following a power surge and failed emergency shutdown, vast plumes of radioactive materials were launched into the atmosphere.
 
Within a radius of 30 kilometers from the station a total evacuation of the population was carried out and an exclusion zone was formed - separating everything within from the rest of the world by way of a protected perimeter.
 
Though extremely deep within Monolith territory, stalkers have attempted to reach this site for years - believing that within can be found a device with the power to grant one their most heartfelt desires. 
 
%c[0,209,209,56]Trivia%c[0,170,170,170] 
• In real-life the Chernobyl NPP is actually located south of Pripyat. 
• It is still possible to see this location in the distance despite actually being there. 
• The northern and southern halves of this location were previously joined together. 
• This location featured in S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Clear Sky. 
• This location featured in S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Shadow of Chernobyl.

%c[0,56,209,115]Information
%c[0,170,170,170]Think of it as the Zone's antechamber - it's a good place for rookies to get their head around. You'll find a trader in the vaults at the back of the village, next to the army outpost. Don't miss the chance to talk to him. You'd be advised to steer clear of the outpost itself, however. You don't want the soldiers to catch sight of you - most of them shoot first and don't bother asking questions later. Yet, as always, there are some who can be bribed as long as the top brass is looking the other way. Attacking the soldiers is not recommended, unless they pose a direct threat. 
 
%c[0,56,166,209]Connected Locations%c[0,170,170,170] 
• Garbage 
• Great Swamps 
• Darkscape 
 
%c[0,209,209,56]Trivia%c[0,170,170,170] 
• A large factory existed here during development until being replaced by the car park. 
• This location featured in S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Clear Sky. 
• This location featured in S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Shadow of Chernobyl.

%c[0,56,209,115]Information
%c[0,170,170,170]Always gloomy, always misty and always rainy. Stalkers venturing into the Dark Valley are likely to find valuable artifacts, instant death, or both. A place frequented by some of the most experienced old-timers, though you may also stumble upon some common bandits. There's supposed to be an underground lab around there somewhere, so it might be worth to look for a hidden entrance along the way. No one has returned from there alive though and no one can tell for sure just what nasty surprises await you there. 
 
%c[0,56,166,209]Connected Locations%c[0,170,170,170] 
• Garbage 
• Darkscape 
• Truck Cemetery 
 
%c[0,209,209,56]Trivia%c[0,170,170,170] 
• This location featured in S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Clear Sky. 
• This location featured in S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Shadow of Chernobyl. 
• This location was once twice as large until the entire eastern half was cut and redesigned.

%c[0,56,209,115]Information
%c[0,170,170,170]A narrow valley shaped roughly like a crescent moon, it connects the southern edge of Dark Valley with the abandoned tunnel in the Cordon. Roads lead out of the area south and east, although where they exactly lead is unknown. It is a densely forested area with few landmarks, however, several of them stand out. At the end of the most narrow part of the valley lies a collapsed train bridge, part of the railway that passes through the Cordon and the Great Swamp. 
Further to the south, the road separates before a hill. To the southwest, deep in the wilderness, lies an abandoned farm house, stripped bare of everything. The main road continues to a crossroads, next to which lies an abandoned gas station. From there, a road leads west, directly to the cordon. 
 
%c[0,56,166,209]Connected Locations%c[0,170,170,170] 
• Cordon 
• Dark Valley 
 
%c[0,209,209,56]Trivia%c[0,170,170,170] 
• This location was cut from S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Shadow of Chernobyl.

The %c[0,250,250,250]Dead City%c[0,170,170,170], once full of energy, is now nothing more than a crumbling ruin.
 
%c[0,56,209,115]Information%c[0,170,170,170] 
Formerly inhabited by those who could not find a home within Limansk or Pripyat, much of the location's history has since been long forgotten.
 
The name given to it by stalkers can be considered an accurate one, likening the city to a corpse because of its condition - decaying and wasting away at the hands of the elements.
 
Despite being under constant siege from invading bandits and mutants, the Mercenary faction has established their headquarters here, maintaining a small but yet powerful presence. 
 
%c[0,56,166,209]Connected Locations%c[0,170,170,170] 
• Limansk 
• Army Warehouses 
• Yantar 
 
%c[0,209,209,56]Trivia%c[0,170,170,170] 
• This location was cut from S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Shadow of Chernobyl.

The %c[0,250,250,250]Deserted Hospital%c[0,170,170,170], or %c[0,56,209,115]Limansk Hospital%c[0,170,170,170], is a large and derelict building almost entirely sunken into the earth.
 
%c[0,56,209,115]Information%c[0,170,170,170] 
Although nothing is publicly known about the history of this hospital, it is safe to presume its intended purpose was to serve the residents of nearby Limansk.
 
One of the location's most interesting features is the fact that it has somehow collapsed into the ground, as earthquakes in this part of the world are extremely uncommon and are usually so small that they go unnoticed.
 
It is also the only major area within the Zone known to be absent of any radioactive or anomalous activity - however it is also one of the most dangerous due to being completely overrun by the Monolith. 
 
%c[0,209,209,56]Trivia%c[0,170,170,170] 
• Psi-storms and emissions cannot occur here as there is nowhere to hide. 
• This location featured in S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Clear Sky. 
• This location did not originally appear on the world map.

%c[0,56,209,115]Information
%c[0,170,170,170]A vast machinery graveyard. Right after the first accident whole heaps of radioactive waste were dumped there. Mostly ruins of old buildings infested with mutants. Much like the outskirts of the Zone, the place swarms with rookie stalkers, with an occasional bandit loitering around, always on the lookout for freebies. Some artifacts can be found here, but most of them are just not worth the effort. You'll be better off elsewhere. Going North, you will get to the Wild Territory, West lays the entrance to Dark Valley, with the road to the Agroprom Research Institute to the East. 
 
%c[0,56,166,209]Connected Locations%c[0,170,170,170] 
• Cordon 
• Darkscape 
• Aprogrom 
• Rostok 
• Wild Territory 
 
%c[0,209,209,56]Trivia%c[0,170,170,170] 
• This location featured in S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Clear Sky. 
• This location featured in S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Shadow of Chernobyl. 
• This location is based on the many real-life scrap heaps that litter the exclusion zone. 
• This location was drastically redesigned during development and was several times larger.

%c[0,56,209,115]Information
%c[0,170,170,170]A vast machinery graveyard. Right after the first accident whole heaps of radioactive waste were dumped there. Mostly ruins of old buildings infested with mutants. Much like the outskirts of the Zone, the place swarms with rookie stalkers, with an occasional bandit loitering around, always on the lookout for freebies. Some artifacts can be found here, but most of them are just not worth the effort. You'll be better off elsewhere. Going North, you will get to the Wild Territory, West lays the entrance to Dark Valley, with the road to the Agroprom Research Institute to the East. 
 
%c[0,56,166,209]Connected Locations%c[0,170,170,170] 
• Cordon 
• Darkscape 
• Aprogrom 
• Rostok 
• Wild Territory 
 
%c[0,209,209,56]Trivia%c[0,170,170,170] 
• A similar location named "Generator" was cut from S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Clear Sky. 
• This location was cut from S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Shadow of Chernobyl.

%c[0,56,209,115]Information
%c[0,170,170,170]The marshlands consist mostly of murky irradiated water and tall reeds, with thin passages of safe land stretching like labyrinthine bridges all over. A few abandoned buildings and settlements dot the landscape. 
To the north lies the Agroprom Research Institute, just beyond the Hunter's Woods. To the east lies the Cordon. And to the west, the mysterious Tuzla tunnel. 
The Great Swamp is where the game begins in Clear Sky, with the player starting out in the base of the Clear Sky faction. It is also the field of battle between Clear Sky and the conquering Renegades. 
 
%c[0,56,166,209]Connected Locations%c[0,170,170,170] 
• Cordon 
• Aprogrom 
 
%c[0,209,209,56]Trivia%c[0,170,170,170] 
• A similar location named "Swamp" was cut from S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Shadow of Chernobyl. 
• This location featured in S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Clear Sky.

%c[0,56,209,115]Information
%c[0,170,170,170]Jupiter, located west of Pripyat, is a large area with Yanov Station near the center. The old train station functions as a camp for many stalkers, including detachments of both the Duty and Freedom factions, and it also houses a trader, a technician and a medic. Scientists have established a bunker near the station, researching the Zone along with its anomalies and artifacts, and some stalkers have also setup camp at an old cement factory to the north-east. Other places, such as the quarry, the village of Kopachy, and the Volkhov AA Complex are long deserted, now only inhabited by mutants and the "walking dead". 
 
%c[0,56,166,209]Connected Locations%c[0,170,170,170] 
• Red Forest 
• Zaton 
• Pripyat 
• Pripyat Underpass 
 
%c[0,209,209,56]Trivia%c[0,170,170,170] 
• This location featured in S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Call of Pripyat.

The %c[0,250,250,250]Jupiter Underground%c[0,170,170,170], also known as the %c[0,56,209,115]Pripyat Underground%c[0,170,170,170] and %c[0,56,209,115]Pripyat-1%c[0,170,170,170], is a series of tunnels which run deep beneath the surface.
 
%c[0,56,209,115]Information%c[0,170,170,170] 
Once used to covertly move goods and materials without being seen, as evidenced by the numerous rusting transports, these secretive tunnels were abandoned and filled with poisonous gases following the second disaster.
 
It wasn't until recently that a group of stalkers managed to re-open the tunnels from the side of Jupiter, allowing enough time for them to be vented and made safe.
 
Of course "safe" is a relative term in the Zone, as those who have ventured below report encountering innumerable snorks and zombified stalkers. 
 
%c[0,209,209,56]Trivia%c[0,170,170,170] 
• This location featured in S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Call of Pripyat. 
• This location was cut from S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Clear Sky.

%c[0,56,209,115]Information
%c[0,170,170,170]This lab is the location of a psi-emitter and the entrance to it can be found in Yantar. Anyone getting too close without the proper protection will be turned into a mindless zombie. 
 
%c[0,209,209,56]Trivia%c[0,170,170,170] 
• This location featured in S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Clear Sky. 
• This location featured in S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Shadow of Chernobyl.

%c[0,56,209,115]Information
%c[0,170,170,170]The entrance to X18 can be found in the Dark Valley and the lab is said to contain valuable information about the psi-emitters. 
 
%c[0,209,209,56]Trivia%c[0,170,170,170] 
• This location featured in S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Shadow of Chernobyl.

%c[0,250,250,250]Lab X-19%c[0,170,170,170], also known as %c[0,56,209,115]Lab X-10%c[0,170,170,170].
 
%c[0,56,209,115]Information
%c[0,170,170,170]This is the lab containing the mechanism that controls the Brain Scorcher. The lab is located deep within the Red Forest and it is heavily guarded by the Monolith. 
 
%c[0,209,209,56]Trivia%c[0,170,170,170] 
• This location featured in S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Shadow of Chernobyl.

%c[0,56,209,115]Information
%c[0,170,170,170]This laboratory is located in Pripyat, beneath the Yubileiny Service Center. The research conducted here focused on many different areas including psy-fields and the noosphere, and the so-called "item 62", a prototype weapon that uses fragments of artifacts to provide astonishing power. It is also very likely that the initial studies leading to the Brain Scorcher were conducted here. Equipment and staff was eventually evacuated to another laboratory, X7, where research on the noosphere would continue. Only a handful of documents remain, and the lab has since its evacuation been used by mercenaries to store equipment. 
 
%c[0,209,209,56]Trivia%c[0,170,170,170] 
• This location featured in S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Call of Pripyat. 
• This location shares an almost identical layout with the Monolith War Lab.

%c[0,56,209,115]Information
%c[0,170,170,170]A secret research city, Limansk is an empty place, abandoned by its former inhabitants. The derelict buildings and vehicles that litter the city witness only the occassional Mercs or Monolith patrols passing through. After the formation of the Zone, it became an even more unwelcoming place, as anomalies filled the city and its surroundings, cutting it off from the world. Only the Monolith and the Mercs found their way into the city. 
When the massive blowout came in September 2011, the anomalies disappeared and stalkers poured into the city, looking for an easy way past the Brain Scorcher and clashed with Bandits and the Monolith. The Limansk war zone is a mandatory element of the player's progress towards the Chernobyl Nuclear Power Plant and a point of no return in the game. 
It lies to the north of the Dead City. 
 
%c[0,56,166,209]Connected Locations%c[0,170,170,170] 
• Dead City 
• Red Forest 
• The Hospital 
 
%c[0,209,209,56]Trivia%c[0,170,170,170] 
• This location featured in S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Clear Sky. 
• This location is influenced by the real-life "Chernobyl-2" military facility.

%c[0,56,209,115]Information%c[0,170,170,170] 
 
%c[0,209,209,56]Trivia%c[0,170,170,170] 
• There exists an inaccessible area which was used only for a cutscene. 
• This location featured in S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Shadow of Chernobyl.

%c[0,56,209,115]Information%c[0,170,170,170] 
 
%c[0,209,209,56]Trivia%c[0,170,170,170] 
• This location shares an almost identical layout with Lab X-8. 
• This location was cut from S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Shadow of Chernobyl.

%c[0,56,209,115]Information
%c[0,170,170,170]The other part of Pripyat, still very much a ghost town. The mutant population is still strong, but the human presence remains neglible; only a few squads of Monolith forces inhabit the area, a group of stalkers has setup a temporary headquarters in the old Laundromat. 
 
%c[0,56,166,209]Connected Locations%c[0,170,170,170] 
• Pripyat 
 
%c[0,209,209,56]Trivia%c[0,170,170,170] 
• This location featured in S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Call of Pripyat. 
• Previously named "Pripyat", we renamed this area to avoid confusion.

%c[0,56,209,115]Information
%c[0,170,170,170]This used to be a town built for engineers working at the Chernobyl NPP. Quite a big place once, it is a ghost town now with mutants and zombies as the only residents. There seems to be no way to get in there: the Brain Scorcher is blocking the way. 
 
%c[0,56,166,209]Connected Locations%c[0,170,170,170] 
• Radar 
• Jupiter 
• Outskirts 
• CNPP 
 
%c[0,209,209,56]Trivia%c[0,170,170,170] 
• This location featured in S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Shadow of Chernobyl.

%c[0,56,209,115]Information
%c[0,170,170,170]The Red Forest is the 10-square-kilometre (4 sq mi) area near the Chernobyl Nuclear Power Plant. The name "Red Forest" comes from the ginger-brown colour of the pine trees after they died following the absorption of high levels of radiation from the Chernobyl accident. The forest considered as one of the most dangerous areas in the zone due to the high mutated activity. 
 
%c[0,56,166,209]Connected Locations%c[0,170,170,170] 
• Army Warhouses 
• Jupiter 
• Limansk 
• Radar 
 
%c[0,209,209,56]Trivia%c[0,170,170,170] 
• This location featured in S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Clear Sky.

%c[0,56,209,115]Information
%c[0,170,170,170]The other part of the Red Forest. A dreadful place. Easy to vanish without a trace there, no matter how lucky you have been in life so far. Whoever gets close to the Brain Scorcher immediately goes insane, turns into a zombie and starts stalking the Zone restlessly. A human shell is all that's left. No-one has ever returned with a sound mind. 
 
%c[0,56,166,209]Connected Locations%c[0,170,170,170] 
• Army Warhouses 
• Red Forest 
• Pripyat 
 
%c[0,209,209,56]Trivia%c[0,170,170,170] 
• This location featured in S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Shadow of Chernobyl.

%c[0,56,209,115]Information
%c[0,170,170,170]The Duty faction have set up camp on the plain's edge and they always welcome stalkers in need of rest. A desert oasis of sorts - a place completely devoid of anomalies and mutants. Be sure to check out the 100 Rads bar in the vaults - it's a meeting point for stalkers from all over the Zone. The bar is run by the local trader, so if you're interested in selling or buying wares apart from the local gossip - that's the place to go. North of the bar is the military base, with the Garbage to the south. 
 
%c[0,56,166,209]Connected Locations%c[0,170,170,170] 
• Wild Territory 
• Garbage 
• Army Warehouses 
• Truck Cemetery 
 
%c[0,209,209,56]Trivia%c[0,170,170,170] 
• The western half of this location was removed and turned into the Wild Territory. 
• There is a large area in this location which is unused and remains inaccessible. 
• This location featured in S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Shadow of Chernobyl.

%c[0,56,209,115]Information
%c[0,170,170,170]The Sarcophagus is inside the fabled reactor 4 of the Chernobyl Nuclear Power Plant. 
 
%c[0,209,209,56]Trivia%c[0,170,170,170] 
• Much of this location is duplicated in Chernobyl NPP, however it remains inaccessible. 
• This location featured in S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Shadow of Chernobyl.

%c[0,170,170,170]The %c[0,250,250,250]Truck Cemetery%c[0,170,170,170], officially the %c[0,56,209,115]Rassokha Equipment Cemetery%c[0,170,170,170], is a giant scrapyard full of irradiated vehicles.
 
%c[0,56,209,115]Information%c[0,170,170,170] 
During clean-up operations following the initial disaster, much heavy machinery was operated in the vicinity of the reactor, and was primarily used to remove highly radioactive materials.
 
Whilst most of the equipment here was in perfect working order but had no practical way of being decontaminated, much of the rest just simply broke down due to the harsh conditions and was dumped here shortly after.
 
In the years following the creation of the Zone as we know it today, the area has become plagued by conflict as Duty and Freedom fight over territory, all the while soldiers and bandits encroach from the east and south.
 
Despite being so isolated and difficult to get to, many stalkers have noticed the vehicles here are gradually being stripped bare - with many believing that somebody, perhaps the military, is attempting to salvage the metals and illegally sell them for scrap. 
 
%c[0,56,166,209]Connected Locations%c[0,170,170,170] 
• Army Warhouses 
• Rostok 
• Dark Valley 
 
%c[0,209,209,56]Trivia%c[0,170,170,170] 
• In real-life all of the vehicles at Rassokha have long since been removed. 
• This location has the largest file size, weighing in at almost quarter of a gigabyte. 
• This location was custom-built exclusively for S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Call of Chernobyl.

%c[0,56,209,115]Information
%c[0,170,170,170]The Wild Territory used to be the site of a rather large manufacturing plant, currently in ruins. Many stalkers met their death there: the place is swarming with all sorts of monsters. The beasts are literally streaming over there from the entire Zone. It is said that something of great importance is hidden at this site, so there are always plenty of daredevils willing to try their luck. 
 
%c[0,56,166,209]Connected Locations%c[0,170,170,170] 
• Rostok 
• Garbage 
• Yantar 
 
%c[0,209,209,56]Trivia%c[0,170,170,170] 
• This location was originally a part of Rostok until its separation. 
• This location featured in S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Shadow of Chernobyl.

%c[0,56,209,115]Information
%c[0,170,170,170]The legendary lake in the sector of the same name dried up a long ago, leaving a shallow swamp in its place. The place is morbid and sodden with death. Great dangers await any adventurous soul foolish enough to get near it. Anyone who dares to go too far goes insane. Zombie drones are rambling around the whole sector, waiting for new victims. If you walk around the lake and past the zombies, you'll end up at the scientists' camp, where the eggheads brought there by choppers are doing some research. You can have a chat with them; they buy artifacts and could even send you on a mission. 
 
%c[0,56,166,209]Connected Locations%c[0,170,170,170] 
• Dead City 
• Wild Territory 
• Aprogrom 
 
%c[0,209,209,56]Trivia%c[0,170,170,170] 
• This location was drastically redesigned during development and was several times larger. 
• This location featured in S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Clear Sky. 
• This location featured in S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Shadow of Chernobyl.

%c[0,250,250,250]Zaton%c[0,170,170,170], or the %c[0,250,250,250]Backwater%c[0,170,170,170], is a dried up channel which once fed into the river Pripyat
 
%c[0,100,255,150]Information%c[0,170,170,170] 
Littered with the wrecks of numerous boats, barges and cargo ships, this location more strongly resembles a swamp than the former industrial site it used to be.
 
Radiation here is minimal aside from a few scattered pockets, but many parts are often found overrun by anomalies, mutants, or zombified stalkers.
 
Although located so far within the center of the Zone and being surrounded by Monolith territories, there are numerous settlements such as the Skadovsk and the Shevchenko. 
 
%c[0,56,166,209]Connected Locations%c[0,170,170,170] 
• Jupiter 
• CNPP 
 
%c[0,100,255,150]Trivia%c[0,170,170,170] 
• Due to an oversight, any flow of water from this location would likely flood Pripyat. 
• This location featured in S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Call of Pripyat.
